docs.lead_paragraph: A woman who used a turkey baster to impregnate herself is on the losing side of a legal battle over parental rights.

headline.main: Virginia Court: Dad Has Rights After Turkey-Baster Pregnancy
headline.print_headline: Virginia Court: Dad Has Rights After Turkey-Baster Pregnancy

docs.lead_paragraph: Legislation that would place licensing restrictions on all seven of Tennessee's abortion clinics was overwhelmingly approved by state lawmakers Tuesday and sent to the governor, who's expected to sign them into law.

headline.main: Restrictions for Tennessee's 7 Abortion Clinics Head to Gov.
headline.print_headline: Restrictions for Tennessee's 7 Abortion Clinics Head to Gov.

docs.snippet: Legislation that would place licensing restrictions on all seven of Tennessee's abortion clinics was overwhelmingly approved by state lawmakers Tuesday and sent to the governor, who's expected to sign them into law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs has reached an out-of-court settlement in London with a female vice president who alleged the Wall Street bank owed her millions of pounds (dollars) in unpaid bonuses and discriminated against her after she revealed she was pregnant.

headline.main: Goldman Sachs Settles London Discrimination Case
headline.print_headline: Goldman Sachs Settles London Discrimination Case

docs.snippet: Goldman Sachs has reached an out-of-court settlement in London with a female vice president who alleged the Wall Street bank owed her millions of pounds (dollars) in unpaid bonuses and discriminated against her after she revealed she was pregnant.

docs.lead_paragraph: An Indonesian court found an American couple guilty of premeditated murder and sentenced them to prison on Tuesday in the killing of the woman's mother on the resort island of Bali.

headline.main: US Couple Sentenced to Prison in Bali Suitcase Killing
headline.print_headline: US Couple Sentenced to Prison in Bali Suitcase Killing

docs.snippet: An Indonesian court found an American couple guilty of premeditated murder and sentenced them to prison on Tuesday in the killing of the woman's mother on the resort island of Bali.

docs.lead_paragraph: A mother who killed six of her newborn babies and hid their bodies in her garage was sentenced to up to life in prison Monday at an emotional hearing in which a prosecutor depicted her as an "incredibly indifferent and callous" murderer.

headline.main: Utah Woman Gets Up to Life in Prison in Deaths of 6 Newborns
headline.print_headline: Utah Woman Gets Up to Life in Prison in Deaths of 6 Newborns

docs.snippet: A mother who killed six of her newborn babies and hid their bodies in her garage was sentenced to up to life in prison Monday at an emotional hearing in which a prosecutor depicted her as an "incredibly indifferent and callous" murderer.

headline.main: Mystery and Danger of Type 1 Diabetes
headline.print_headline: A Mysterious Rise in Type 1 Diabetes

docs.abstract: Childhood stress may be a factor in a disease without a clear cause that hits adults too.
docs.snippet: Childhood stress may be a factor in a disease without a clear cause that hits adults too.

docs.lead_paragraph: A claim set to be filed Monday says that the Walmart store closings were in retaliation for a history of labor activism at one of the shuttered stores.

headline.main: Laid-Off Walmart Workers Head to Labor Board
headline.print_headline: Laid-Off Walmart Workers Head to Labor Board

docs.abstract: United Food and Commercial Workers International Union plans to seek injunction from National Labor Relations Board that would require Walmart to rehire all 2,200 workers who were laid off after abrupt closing of five stores.
docs.snippet: A claim set to be filed Monday says that the Walmart store closings were in retaliation for a history of labor activism at one of the shuttered stores.

keywords.value: United Food and Commercial Workers Union
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Low-wage jobs are no longer the only ones at risk.
docs.abstract: Zeynep Tufekci Op-Ed article warns that advances in software and robotics will not only take away low-wage jobs, but also will shift balance of power in workplace in favor of employers; suggests that standard response of urging people to learn more skills will not address problem, and that true solution requires examination of how humans value one another.
docs.snippet: Low-wage jobs are no longer the only ones at risk.

docs.lead_paragraph: The project asked artists to look at a work, create a response to it, then pass it on.

headline.main: ‘Telephone: An International Arts Experiment’ by Nathan Langston
headline.print_headline: Psst, Look at This. Now, Pass It On.

docs.abstract: Interactive installation opening at Bowery Poetry Club will highlight 315 artworks created as part of five-year-long art project inspired by children's game Telephone; project, developed by Brooklyn poet and composer Nathan Langston, asked artists around the world to create a response to another artist's work and then pass it on.
docs.snippet: The project asked artists to look at a work, create a response to it, then pass it on.

docs.lead_paragraph: For U.S. moms, the typical time between pregnancies is about 2½ years but nearly a third of women space their children too close, a government study shows.

headline.main: Study: US Moms Typically Space Pregnancies 2½ Years Apart
headline.print_headline: Study: US Moms Typically Space Pregnancies 2½ Years Apart

docs.snippet: For U.S. moms, the typical time between pregnancies is about 2½ years but nearly a third of women space their children too close, a government study shows.
